title: 2005년 United States v. Gregory Johnson, A/K/A Little Greg, United States of America v. Gregory Johnson, A/K/A Little Greg 사건
summary: 미국 USA, Federal 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: United States v. Gregory Johnson, A/K/A Little Greg, United States of America v. Gregory Johnson, A/K/A Little Greg. 판결일: 2005-03-08. 법원: Court of Appeals for the Fourth Circuit.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. Gregory JOHNSON, A/K/A Little Greg, Defendant-Appellant; United States of America, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. Gregory Johnson, A/K/A Little Greg, Defendant-Appellant
**판결일**: 2005-03-08
**법원**: Court of Appeals for the Fourth Circuit
**관할**: USA, Federal

**판사**: Conrad, Glen, Motz, Western, Widener

## 변호인

ARGUED: Timothy Joseph Sullivan, Sullivan & Sullivan, College Park, Maryland, for Appellant. Deborah A. Johnston, Assistant United States Attorney, Office of the United States Attorney, Greenbelt, Maryland, for Appellee. ON BRIEF: Thomas M. DiBiagio, United States Attorney, Baltimore, Maryland, for Appellee.

## 인용

- 400 F.3d 187

## 판결문 요약

400 F.3d 187
    UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee,v.Gregory JOHNSON, a/k/a Little Greg, Defendant-Appellant.United States of America, Plaintiff-Appellee,v.Gregory Johnson, a/k/a Little Greg, Defendant-Appellant.
    No. 03-4677.
    No. 03-4849.
    United States Court of Appeals, Fourth Circuit.
    Argued: October 29, 2004.
    Decided: March 8, 2005.
    
      COPYRIGHT MATERIAL OMITTED ARGUED: Timothy Joseph Sullivan, Sullivan & Sullivan, College Park, Maryland, for Appellant. Deborah A. Johnston, Assistant United States Attorney, Office of the United States Attorney, Greenbelt, Maryland, for Appellee. ON BRIEF: Thomas M. DiBiagio, United States Attorney, Baltimore, Maryland, for Appellee.
      Before WIDENER and MOTZ, Circuit Judges, and Glen E. CONRAD, United States District Judge for the Western District of Virginia, sitting by designation.
      Affirmed in part, vacated in part, and remanded by published opinion. Judge MOTZ wrote the opinion, in which Judge WIDENER and Judge CONRAD joined.
      OPINION
      DIANA GRIBBON MOTZ, Circuit Judge:
    
    
      1
      After a jury convicted Gregory Anthony Johnson of kidnaping, twice using a firearm in the commission of a crime of violence, and attempting to kill a potential witness, the district court sentenced him to imprisonment and ordered him to pay restitution to the victim and to Family & Child Services, a mental health agency that provided counseling to the victim at a reduced rate. Johns...
